parameters: \pop[2]As soon as the door opens, we make our way to the lobby.
\pop[2]However, the sight we're greeted to is \c[14]far\c[0] from pleasant.
\pop[2]In fact, it makes me feel the exact opposite of how I felt when I was here before.
\pop[2]At first, I was stunned by the beauty. The potential grace and majesty of \c[10]Argus\c[0].
\pop[2]But now, all I see is \c[10]Argus\c[0] flaunting their strength on people simply fighting for their ideals.
\pop[2]Dozens of armed guards line the lobby, holding up rifles at us as we exit the elevator.
\pop[2]They tell us to raise our hands, so we comply.
\pop[2]Compliance through fear? That's \c[14]just\c[0] what the leader of \c[10]Argus\c[0] wanted to avoid.
\pop[2]Yet here we stand, our lives in the hands of those we came to directly oppose.
\pop[2]I look at Klace, who continues to hold up Isaac.
\pop[2]It's clear that the wound wasn't fatal, and he'd be just fine with some treatment.
\pop[2]All we had to do was talk ourselves out of this. It seemed like Dante was up to bat.
\pop[8]I'm going to take a few steps forward.
\pop[2]Wait. This is just what Isaac did in our R&R campaign...
\pop[2]Dante is trembling in fear as he takes those few steps.
\pop[2]The light shining down from the sunroof strikes the drive in his hands.
\pop[2]It almost exaggerates it, subtly grabbing the attention of the guards.
So please, hear me out before you make a decision.
\pop[2]He gulps, the lasers from the guns focused solely upon him.
\pop[2]From the sky, we can hear a chopper. It looks to be from one of the news stations.
\pop[2]They have a camera pointed down through the sunroof, filming the entire ordeal.
\pop[2]That must mean we're being broadcast live around the world...
\pop[2]Now, \c[14]everybody\c[0] would know who we were. That's terrifying.
\pop[2]Dante seems to realize he can use this against the guards.
\pop[8]You see what I'm holding in my hand?
This is a drive, full of \c[10]Argus\c[0]' most classified documents.
\pop[2]The guards immediately change their stance, like they're ready to fire.
\pop[8]If you kill us, you can retrieve the drive, sure.
But this isn't the only copy. So listen close.
\pop[8]We sent copies of these files to \c[14]several\c[0] \c[23]Cipher\c[0] computers.
If any of us die, our team has the approval to leak them.
\pop[2]Clearly a bluff, but the guards lower their stance.
\pop[8]So \c[14]if\c[0] you shoot, every secret you tried to cover up will come to light.
And not only that, but you'll murder us in front of the entire world.
\pop[2]Dante tilts his head up, reminding them of the helicopter's presence.
\pop[8]A world that you already \c[14]know\c[0] has turned against \c[10]Argus\c[0].
How do you think they'll greet you when you go back outside?
\pop[2]I look behind the guards, and notice a large gathering in front of the building.
\pop[2]The people must've rushed here after the leader fled the town square.
\pop[2]And to make it even better, I can hear them cheering on \c[23]Hermes\c[0]...
\pop[8]Put down your guns, and let us leave.
I've seen some of these files. It's not worth it.
\pop[8]Didn't you hear what your leader said?
You can't hold authority through fear.
Are you scared of losing points? Is that it?
\pop[8]Always looking to pass the dirty work down a few levels.
Well if it's points you're after, then go ahead and shoot!
It won't matter what your score is anymore.
\pop[8]We can all hold \c[14]each other\c[0] accountable, now.
\c[10]Argus\c[0] isn't the only path forward. It never was.
You can either be \c[14]with\c[0] us, or \c[14]against\c[0] us.
\c[14]Don't\c[0] cling to the remnants of her power.
\pop[8]Because \c[10]Argus\c[0] \c[14]will\c[0] be held accountable for everything they've done.
And your actions will decide whether you go down with them, or rise with us.
\pop[2]His final words echo through the atrium.
\pop[2]He did always have a way with words, though.
\pop[2]I can sense the hesitation in the guards. The sheer apprehension.
\pop[2]They're just waiting to see who acts first. The rest would probably follow suit.
\pop[2]He turns his attention back toward the guards.
We can go outside, and greet the new world as allies.
\pop[2]The next few moments feel like an eternity.
\pop[2]I can feel my heart beat faster and stronger than ever before.
\pop[2]And I know that my friends all feel the exact same way.
\pop[2]Unified in our fear that these may be our last moments alive.
\pop[2]But like we always said... If we went down, we'd go down \c[14]together\c[0].
\pop[2]That's what really mattered. That we had each other's backs, until the end.
\pop[2]Soon enough, our hostile greeting has reached its end.
\pop[2]The guards move aside, giving us the freedom to exit the building.
We've gotta go to that colony.
\pop[2]We start taking slow, cautious steps toward the exit.
\pop[2]The crowd outside is still cheering out \c[23]Hermes\c[0]' name.
\pop[2]A lot of them must be \c[23]zeros\c[0] from the town square...
\pop[4]I think you have a bit of a welcoming party, Isaac.
\pop[2]Isaac simply smirks, as we leave the building.
\pop[2]The crowd goes silent upon seeing our group. It's almost eerie.
\pop[2]I know that most of those people are \c[23]zeros\c[0] and agents of \c[23]Cipher\c[0].
\pop[2]Isaac waves at them, as if to signal that he's \c[23]Hermes\c[0].
\pop[2]They \c[14]are\c[0] seeing their leader, and champion, for the first time, after all.
\pop[2]The rigorous cheering is now met with happy smiles and knowing nods.
\pop[2]I'm reminded of the night we left the club, and Dante dropped that booze.
\pop[2]Everyone stayed far away from us, scared to approach and interact with a \c[23]zero\c[0].
\pop[2]But now? They're all together, in unity. It's impossible to tell who belongs to what group.
\pop[2]Well, I guess there weren't "groups" anymore. That was the point of all this.
\pop[2]The crowd moves aside, giving us a clear path to Isaac's car.
\pop[2]At least, it \c[14]appeared\c[0] to be a clear path.
\pop[2]Standing there, staring right at me, is that child.
\pop[2]They smile at me, and I do the same in return, just like before.
\pop[2]It's almost like they knew I was special, right from the beginning.
\pop[2]Despite the circumstances, I don't see any hint of grief on their face.
\pop[2]They stand, surrounded by city-folk, and zeros, in the new world their parents fought for.
\pop[2]A new world, that - even though it may be hard to believe â€“ was created by \c[14]us\c[0].
\pop[2]Our victory ensured that the deaths of their parents weren't in vain.
\pop[2]And I can see, from the look on their face, that they understand this.
\pop[2]An understanding conveyed without words, just like our entire bond thus far.
\pop[2]The child realizes they were staring, and shakes their head with embarrassment.
\pop[2]Then, they run off to the side, fully opening the path to the car.
\pop[2]We can't waste any more time, so we start to rush inside.
\pop[2]Taylor opens the trunk, and puts the bat back inside.
\pop[2]I can see him retrieve a first-aid kit, and a bottle of booze.
\pop[2]Dante gets in the drivers seat, and Kyron, the passenger seat.
\pop[2]Myself, Taylor, and Klace are left to patch Isaac up in the back.
\pop[2]I guess our destination was Kyron's colony. An escape from Toronto...
